For <FI>there are<Fi> no bands in their death: but their strength <FI>is<Fi> firm.<RF>firm: Heb. fat<Rf>

Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.<RF>have…: Heb. pass the thoughts of the heart<Rf>
They are corrupt, and speak wickedly <FI>concerning<Fi> oppression: they speak loftily.
They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full <FI>cup<Fi> are wrung out to them.
And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
Behold, these <FI>are<Fi> the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase <FI>in<Fi> riches.
Verily I have cleansed my heart <FI>in<Fi> vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

When I thought to know this, it <FI>was<Fi> too painful for me;<RF>too…: Heb. labour in mine eyes<Rf>

How are they <FI>brought<Fi> into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
So foolish <FI>was<Fi> I, and ignorant: I was <FI>as<Fi> a beast before thee.<RF>ignorant: Heb. I knew not<Rf><RF>before Heb. with<Rf>
Nevertheless I <FI>am<Fi> continually with thee: thou hast holden <FI>me<Fi> by my right hand.

Whom have I in heaven <FI>but thee<Fi>? and <FI>there is<Fi> none upon earth <FI>that<Fi> I desire beside thee.

For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
But <FI>it is<Fi> good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.<CM>
